data.title: 准备以至少20秒的时间回答以下问题
data.answer: Although celebrities are expected to speak and behave correctly to a high standard because their fans will look up to them and imitate them, famous singers, actors, and other celebrities can provide unhealthy role models. Personally, celebrity influence on body image and substance use is often detrimental to teen mental health. A large proportion of teenagers compare themselves to images they see of celebrities. Moreover, almost half of them said that celebrity images make them feel dissatisfied with the way they look. Therefore, appearance is among teenagers' top concerns, teen girls in particular.  Body dissatisfaction is linked to mental health challenges, including eating disorders, depression, and low self-esteem. Young women who consume media with many images of an unrealistic "thin ideal" are more likely to exhibit symptoms of disordered eating. Nearly half of teen girls wish they were as skinny as the models in fashion magazines. Besides, celebrities can have a leading effect on teenagers' endorsement. Hence, many influencers advertise a broad range of goods. The associated problem is that not all the goods influencers sell have been tested for their real effect, and influencers are simply reading lines and get paid by companies that hired them. And in some cases, the goods can actually have an adverse effect on teenagers' health or other aspects.（215 字）
data.referenceText: Some people think celebrities are not good role models for teenagers. Do you agree or disagree? And why?
data.referenceTranslate: 有些人认为名人不是青少年的好榜样。你同意还是不同意？为什么？
